subject: Alpine Skiing
Skiing
lead_paragraph: The American Lindsey Vonn led the downhill portion of the super-combi at Val d’Isère, France, but was disqualified from the slalom for splitting a gate. Kathrin Zettel of Austria was the surprise winner, posting the fifth-fastest downhill and the third-fastest slalom. Zettel had a combined time of 2 minutes 20.13 seconds. The Swiss teenager Lara Gut, 17, finished second, 0.56 seconds behind. Elisabeth Görgl of Austria was third, 0.88 back.
